Description: Rim fragment of North Ionian pottery plate. Cream slip. Stopt maeander band on top of rim; at edge of floor, band with added red band lined in white; to the centre, metopal frieze of dot rosettes and sets of tongues, some in red; banding on unslipped underside
Production place: Made in: North Ionia (perhaps Klazomenai, as is suggested by the analysis of the comparable piece in the British Museum)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare British Museum 1888,0601.544.d. In view of the fluctuation of design on that piece, this sherd could well be from the same plate.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.699)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p.4, pl. 3,11)
